verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
Can a man be profitable unto God, As he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
\add Is it any\add* pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? Or \add is it\add* gain \add to him\add*, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? Will he enter with thee into judgment?
\add Is\add* not thy wickedness great? And thine iniquities infinite?
For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, And stripped the naked of their clothing.
Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, And thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
But \add as for\add* the mighty man, he had the earth; And the honourable \add man\add* dwelt in it.
Thou hast sent widows away empty, And the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
Therefore snares \add are\add* round about thee, And sudden fear troubleth thee;
Or darkness, \add that\add* thou canst not see; And abundance of waters cover thee.
\add Is\add* not God \add in\add* the height of heaven? And behold the height of the stars, how high they are.
And thou sayest, How doth God know? Can he judge through the dark \add cloud?\add*
Thick clouds \add are\add* a covering to him, that he seeth not; And he walketh \add in\add* the circuit of heaven.
Hast thou marked the old way Which wicked men have trodden?
Which were cut down out of time, Whose foundation was overflown \add with\add* a flood:
Which said unto God, Depart from us: And what can the Almighty do for them?
Yet he filled their houses \add with\add* good \add things:\add* But the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
The righteous see \add it\add*, and are glad: And the innocent laugh them to scorn.
Whereas our substance is not cut down, But the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: Thereby good shall come \add unto\add* thee.
Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, And lay up his words in thine heart.
If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built \add up\add*, Thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, And \add the gold of\add* Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, And thou shalt have plenty of silver.
For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, And shalt lift up thy face unto God.
Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, And thou shalt pay thy vows.
Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: And the light shall shine upon thy ways.
When \add men\add* are cast down, then thou shalt say, \add There is\add* lifting up; And he shall save the humble person.
He shall deliver the island of the innocent: And it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
